question: Yahya Sinwar still Hamas leader before September?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Yahya Sinwar remains leader of Hamas in the Gaza Strip uninterrupted from May 28 through August 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be a consensus of credible reporting.

question: Israel x Hamas ceasefire before October?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if there is an official ceasefire agreement, defined as a publicly announced and mutually agreed halt in military engagement, between Israel and Hamas between August 18, 12:00 PM ET and September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET.

An official ceasefire agreement requires public recognition by both parties. Any form of informal, unratified, or verbal agreement will not be considered an official ceasefire. The ceasefire must last at least 24 hours and have begun before the resolution date. For example, if the ceasefire begins on September 30, this market would resolve to "Yes" if the ceasefire continues for 24 hours.

This market's resolution will be based on official government announcements from both Israel and Hamas, or reports from credible media source

question: Iran military response by Friday?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, maritime territory or any official Israeli embassy or consulate between August 25 and August 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, maritime territory or any official Israeli embassy or consulate (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

In the case that the "Yes" resolution criteria are met prior to this market's resolution date, this market will resolve immediately.

In the case that the "Yes" resolution criteria are met prior to this market's resolution date, this market will resolve immediately.

question: Will Donald Trump say "border" 10 or more times during Michigan town hall?
description:
Donald Trump is scheduled to host a town hall event in La Crosse, Wisconsin, scheduled for Thursday, August 29, 2024.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Trump says "border" 10 or more times during his appearance at this event. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Compound words will count as long as "border" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to belonging to a political boundary between nations.

If this candidate does not give a speech at this event, or if the event is otherwise cancelled or delayed beyond August 29, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be the video of the speech.

events.title: What will Trump say during Wisconsin town hall?
events.description: This is a market group about what Donald Trump will say during his scheduled town hall event in La Crosse, Wisconsin, scheduled for Thursday, August 29, 2024.

question: Will Donald Trump say "marxist" during Michigan town hall?
description:
Donald Trump is scheduled to host a town hall event in La Crosse, Wisconsin, scheduled for Thursday, August 29, 2024.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Trump says "marxist" during his appearance at this event. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Compound words will count as long as "marxist" is part of the compound word and references something relating to or denoting the political and economic theories of Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels.

If this candidate does not give a speech at this event, or if the event is otherwise cancelled or delayed beyond August 29, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be the video of the speech.

events.description: This is a market group about what Donald Trump will say during his scheduled town hall event in La Crosse, Wisconsin, scheduled for Thursday, August 29, 2024.

question: CFB: Murray State vs. Missouri
description:
In the upcoming NCAA Football game, scheduled for August 29 at 8:00 PM ET:

If the Murray State Racers win, the market will resolve to “Murray State”.

If the Missouri Tigers win, the market will resolve to “Missouri”.

If the game is not completed by September 5, 2024 (11:59 PM ET) or it ends in a tie, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will California pass SB 1047 AI safety bill?
description:
California's SB 1047 AI safety bill is currently being debated in the state assembly. Legislators have until August 31 to pass it, and if approved, the Governor has until September 30 to sign it into law.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if SB 1047 AI safety bill becomes law by September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM PT. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

If the bill does not pass the state assembly by the end of their legislative session on August 31, this market will resolve to "No".

Note that if the Governor vetoes the bill, the market will stay open until September 30 to allow for any potential overriding of the veto.

If the bill doesn't pass by September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM PT this market will resolve to "No."

question: Macron impeached in 2024?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if a proposal to impeach Emmanuel Macron, the President of France, is adopted by both the National Assembly and the Senate by December 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". 

The primary resolution source for this market will be information from the government of France, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: PA-10 election: Stelson (D) vs. Perry (R)
description:
United States general elections are scheduled to take place on November 5, 2024.

This market will resolve to "Stelson" if Democrat Janelle Stelson wins the congressional election in Pennsylvania's 10th district.

This market will resolve to "Perry" if Republican Scott Perry wins the congressional election in Pennsylvania's 10th district.

If any other candidate wins the election, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source for this market is a consensus of credible reporting.

question: Macron out as president of France in 2024?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Emmanuel Macron ceases to be the President of France for any period of time between August 26, 2024 and December 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

The resolution source for this market will be the government of France, however a consensus of credible reporting will also suffice.

question: 'Beetlejuice Beetlejuice' record September opening?
description:
This is a market on how much 'Beetlejuice Beetlejuice' (2024) will gross domestically on its opening weekend, specifically if it will set a record for highest domestic gross in September (https://www.boxofficemojo.com/chart/release_top_opn_wkd_in_month/?in_occasion=september). The “Domestic Weekend” tab on https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt2049403/ will be used to resolve this market once the values for the 3-day opening weekend (September 6 - 8) are final (i.e. not studio estimates).

This market will resolve to "Yes" if 'Beetlejuice Beetlejuice' (2024) grosses more than $123,403,419 on its 3-day opening weekend. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Please note, this market will resolve according to the Box Office Mojo numbers under Domestic Weekend for the 3-day weekend (which typically includes Thursday's previews), regardless of whether domestic refers to only the USA, or to USA and Canada, etc.

If there is no final data available by September 16, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, another credible resolution source will be chosen.

question: U.S. military action against Iran by September 30?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the United States initiates a military action on Iranian soil, airspace, or maritime territory between August 26 and September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by the U.S. on Iranian soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Iranian soil is hit by an U.S. missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the U.S. government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

In the case that the "Yes" resolution criteria are met prior to this market's resolution date, this market will resolve immediately.

question: Candidates seated at ABC debate?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the candidates are seated for the ABC-hosted presidential debate, currently scheduled for September 10, 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

If the September 10, 2024, debate is postponed, this market will apply to the first ABC-hosted presidential debate that occurs before the 2024 election. If no ABC-hosted presidential debate occurs before the 2024 election this market will resolve to "No".

The candidate's will be considered “seated” if at least one of the candidates is provided with a chair from which they can conduct debate. Candidates choosing to stand up or sit down during the debate will not affect the resolution of the market.

The resolution source will be the official debate broadcast and information from ABC, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

events.description:

The candidate's will be considered “seated” if at least one of the candidates is provided with a chair from which they can conduct debate. Candidates choosing to stand up or sit down during the debate will not affect the resolution of the market.

The resolution source will be the official debate broadcast and information from ABC, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if footage of Donald Trump answering at least one question asked by threadguy (@notthreadguy) is released by September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The exchange must be in person, and recorded on video.

question: Will Kamala Harris give an interview by Aug 31?
description:
Vice President Kamala Harris has yet to participate in a formal interview since becoming the Democratic presidential nominee, raising speculation on when she will give her first interview (see: https://www.politico.com/newsletters/playbook/2024/08/27/inside-harris-big-interview-decision-00176402)

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Kamala Harris is interviewed between August 26, and August 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, an interview is defined as a scheduled, recorded conversation where Kamala Harris answers questions posed by a member of the news media. Press conferences or media briefings held by the White House will not count as interviews for the purposes of this market.

If there is a credible consensus of reporting that Kamala Harris has recorded an interview before the resolution date this market will resolve to "Yes", even if that interview is not yet released.

The resolution source for this market will be a consensus of credible reporting.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Kamala Harris is interviewed between August 26, and August 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

question: Confirmed case of monkeypox in US by Oct 31?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if there is a confirmed case of Monkeypox (Mpox) Clade 1 in the territory of the United States of America reported between August 26 and October 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official government information (e.g. the CDC), however sources from NGOs like the WHO, or information from other reputable medical institutions may also be used.

events.description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if there is a confirmed case of Monkeypox (Mpox) Clade 1 in the territory of the United States of America reported between August 26 and October 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official government information (e.g. the CDC), however sources from NGOs like the WHO, or information from other reputable medical institutions may also be used.

question: Will Kamala Harris give an interview before Sept 10?
description:
Vice President Kamala Harris has yet to participate in a formal interview since becoming the Democratic presidential nominee, raising speculation on when she will give her first interview (see: https://www.politico.com/newsletters/playbook/2024/08/27/inside-harris-big-interview-decision-00176402)

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Kamala Harris is interviewed between August 26, and September 9, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, an interview is defined as a scheduled, recorded conversation where Kamala Harris answers questions posed by a member of the news media. Press conferences or media briefings held by the White House will not count as interviews for the purposes of this market.

If there is a credible consensus of reporting that Kamala Harris has recorded an interview before the resolution date this market will resolve to "Yes", even if that interview is not yet released.

The resolution source for this market will be a consensus of credible reporting.

For the purposes of this market, an interview is defined as a scheduled, recorded conversation where Kamala Harris answers questions posed by a member of the news media. Press conferences or media briefings held by the White House will not count as interviews for the purposes of this market.

If there is a credible consensus of reporting that Kamala Harris has recorded an interview before the resolution date this market will resolve to "Yes", even if that interview is not yet released.

question: Clemson vs. Georgia winner?
description:
In the upcoming NCAA Football game, scheduled for August 29 at 8:00 PM ET:

If the Clemson Tigers win, the market will resolve to “Clemson”

If the Georgia Bulldogs win, the market will resolve to “Georgia".

If the game is not completed by September 7, 2024 (11:59 PM ET) or it ends in a tie, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will there be 49 or more combined points scored?
description:
This market refers to the NCAAF matchup between the Clemson Tigers and Georgia Bulldogs scheduled for August 31, 2024.

If the combined total points scored by the Clemson Tigers and the Georgia Bulldogs in their game on August 31, 2024 is 49 or more, this market will resolve to "Yes". If it is less than 49 this market will resolve to "No".

If this game is postponed after September 7, 2024 (11:59 PM ET), or cancelled, this market will resolve 50-50.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the NCAA, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Miami vs. Florida winner?
description:
In the upcoming NCAA Football game, scheduled for August 31 at 8:00 PM ET:

If the Miami Hurricanes win, the market will resolve to “Miami”

If the Florida Gators win, the market will resolve to “Florida.”

If the game is not completed by September 7, 2024 (11:59 PM ET) or it ends in a tie, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Ethereum dips below $2,000 by Sept 30?
description:
This market will immediately resolve to “Yes” if any Binance 1 minute candle for Ethereum ETH-USDT between August 26, 23:59 ET and September 30, 23:59 ET has a final “Low” price of 1,999.99 or less. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market is Binance, specifically the ETH-USDT "Low" prices currently available at https://www.binance.com/en/trade/ETH_USDT with “1m” candles selected on the top bar.

To see the "Low" prices, mouse over particular candles and look at the value "Low" at the top of the chart.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance ETH-USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Will LSU beat USC?
description:
In the upcoming NCAA Football game, scheduled for September 1 at 7:30 PM ET:

If the LSU Tigers win, the market will resolve to “LSU.”

If the USC Trojans win, the market will resolve to “USC.”

If the game is not completed by September 8, 2024 (11:59 PM ET) or it ends in a tie, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will there be 65 or more combined points scored?
description:
This market refers to the NCAAF matchup between the LSU Tigers and USC Trojans scheduled for September 1, 2024.

If the combined total points scored by the LSU Tigers and the USC Trojans in their game on September 1, 2024, is 65 or more, this market will resolve to “Yes”. If it is less than 65, this market will resolve to “No”.

If this game is postponed after September 8, 2024 (11:59 PM ET), or cancelled, this market will resolve 50-50.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the NCAA, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Notre Dame vs. Texas A&M winner?
description:

If the Texas A&M Aggies win, the market will resolve to “Texas A&M.”

If the Notre Dame Fighting Irish win, the market will resolve to “Notre Dame.”

If the game is not completed by September 7, 2024 (11:59 PM ET) or it ends in a tie, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will Texas A&M win by 3 or more points?
description:
This market refers to the NCAAF matchup between the Notre Dame Fighting Irish and Texas A&M Aggies scheduled for August 31, 2024.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the Texas A&M Aggies win their game against the Notre Dame Fighting Irish by 3 or more points.

Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No.”

If this game is postponed after September 7th, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, or cancelled, this market will resolve 50-50.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the NCAA, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.
